stimulusHtml: Of the following diagrams, which represents the most appropriate design for the Book class?

features.html:
The Book class will contain attributes for a book’s title, author, and number of pages. The class will also contain methods to allow the attributes to be accessed outside the class.

A class design diagram for the Book class will contain three sections. The first section contains the class name, the second section contains three instance variables and their data types, and the third section contains three methods and their return types. The + symbol indicates a public designation, and the - symbol indicates a private designation.

choicesHtml:
• The diagram has 3 sections containing text as follows:

    • Section 1:

      • Book

    • Section 2:

      • + title : String

      • + author : String

      • + numPages : String

    • Section 3:

      • - getTitle() : String

      • - getAuthor() : String

      • - getNumPages() : String

• The diagram has 3 sections containing text as follows:

    • Section 1:

      • Book

    • Section 2:

      • - title : String

      • - author : String

      • - numPages : String

    • Section 3:

      • + getTitle() : String

      • + getAuthor() : String

      • + getNumPages() : String

• The diagram has 3 sections containing text as follows:

    • Section 1:

      • Book

    • Section 2:

      • + title : String

      • + author : String

      • + numPages : int

    • Section 3:

      • - getTitle() : String

      • - getAuthor() : String

      • - getNumPages() : int

• The diagram has 3 sections containing text as follows:

    • Section 1:

      • Book

    • Section 2:

      • - title : String

      • - author : String

      • - numPages : int

    • Section 3:

      • + getTitle() : String

      • + getAuthor() : String

      • + getNumPages() : int
